column4: Is there a way to get the 'Computer' and 'Home' On the desktop like how it is in horay or whatever its called???
hoary
and, you can use gconf-editor for that I think

http://www.ubuntulinux.org/support/documentation/faq/helpcenterfaq.2004-09-16.1393795212/view
that's normal
is there any way to make it quit saying that?
yes, reading the manual
alsamixer
lineakd? why not just use the gnome shortcut key thingy?
what kind of keyboard do you have?
what kind of keyboard do you have?
is it like the 2505 ?
not sure
change "pc104" or "pc105" in your xorg.conf or XF86Config-4 to "hp5105"
what for?
that way X will recognise your "special" keys by name (the "WWW" button will be XF86WWW, etc.)
so if you assign them in the gnome shortcut manager, you'll see the name of the key instead of some code
/etc/X11/skb/symbols/inet
oh wait
is there a list somewhere for keyboards for xorg.conf?
uh yes, but I usually look around in /etc/X11/xkb/symbols/inet (if it's an internet keyboard, otherwise just stick with pc104 or pc105)
the package also plays nice with the debian "alternatives" system and the other java-packages available
